description: Israel Defense Forces say it was targeting Hamas and Islamic Jihad fighters hiding in a school when it bombed the compound today killing 40 people including women and children. The Department of State's Matt Miller called on Israel to be fully transparent about the blast and President Biden is demanding Hamas accept a ceasefire proposal. NBC News' Raf Sanchez reports.
title: Israel defends airstrike on a UN school in Gaza that left dozens dead, including children

description: President Biden joined world leaders in France to honor WWII veterans and commemorate the Normandy landings 80 years ago. The allied invasion led to the liberation of Europe from Nazi Germany. President Biden also delivered a warning about protecting democracy amid increasing global unrest. NBC News' Peter Alexander reports.
title: Biden joins world leaders saluting D-Day heroes on 80th anniversary

description: Services across France today marked 80 years since D-Day. The heroes from that day were honored for helping liberate Europe. NBC News' Kelly Cobiella reports.
title: Heroes from D-Day received the highest honors after storming the beaches 80 years ago

description: Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin joined Lester Holt in an exclusive one-on-one from Normandy to discuss the world order with the backdrop of the D-Day anniversary and America's uneasy embrace of key ally Israel as the death toll mounts in Israel's war with Hamas. NBC News' Lester Holt reports.
title: Lester Holt Reports: Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin discusses America's role in Israel-Hamas war

description: NBC News filmed the damage caused by the Nuseirat airstrike, and dozens of dead and wounded victims at Al-Aqsa Hospital in Deir al-Balah. Israel said it was targeting Hamas fighters sheltering in the school, but a significant number of the casualties were reportedly women and children.
title: Dozens killed in Israeli attack on UNRWA school in Gaza

description: Around 200 veterans attended this year’s D-Day event in Normandy, the youngest in their 90s and some over 100.
title: D-Day’s last living links recount brutal, and inspiring, memories on Normandy’s beaches

description: “You’re the savior of the people,” the veteran told the Ukrainian president as the two men embraced. “No, no you. You saved Europe,” replied Zelenskyy.
title: Zelenskyy shares emotional moment with U.S. veteran in Normandy

description: President Joe Biden and other world leaders stood side by side with WWII veterans, marking the 80th anniversary of the D-Day invasion. NBC News' Kelly O'Donnell reports on Biden's remarks from the ceremony in Normandy, France.
title: Biden stands with WWII veterans to mark D-Day 80th anniversary

description: A court in Vladivostok, Russia, on Thursday began the trial of Staff Sgt. Gordon Black, an American soldier arrested in the city earlier this year on charges of stealing.
title: U.S. soldier appears in Russian court accused by his girlfriend of stealing from her

description: Watch the 21-gun salute and flyover in Normandy as President Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron attended a ceremony for the 80th anniversary of D-Day.
title: Watch: 21-gun salute in Normandy for 80th anniversary of D-Day

description: While speaking about D-Day at the 80th anniversary event in Normandy President Biden stressed the importance of alliances and democracy while mentioning Russia’s war in Ukraine. Biden said, “Ukrainians are fighting with extraordinary courage, suffering great losses but never backing down.”
title: ‘Democracy is never guaranteed’: Biden speaks about Ukraine during D-Day speech

description: While speaking at the D-Day 80th anniversary event in Normandy, France, President Joe Biden name-checked individual U.S. veterans attending the commemoration. He specifically named a woman who was an aircraft mechanic and a member of the Tuskegee Airmen.
title: Biden name-checks individual veterans attending the D-Day ceremony

description: President Joe Biden addressed World War II veterans and guests to mark the 80th anniversary of D-Day, when Allied forces’ surprise attack helped liberate Europe from Nazi Germany. During the president’s address, Biden took the time to salute the WWII veterans sitting behind him.
title: Biden salutes WWII veterans during D-Day 80th anniversary speech in Normandy

description: A court in Russia’s far eastern city of Vladivostok on Thursday began the trial of an American soldier arrested earlier this year on charges of stealing.
title: Russian court begins trial of US soldier arrested on theft charges

description: Biden and Zelenskyy are due to meet in France as Ukrainian officials grow increasingly frustrated by the pace of military aid and U.S. criticisms of corruption.
title: Biden and Zelenskyy to meet amid tensions over pace of U.S. military aid

description: A lone piper landed on the beach in Arromanches on an amphibious vehicle to re-enact the moment British troops landed in France. Veterans and world leaders gathered in Normandy on Thursday to mark the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings, when more than 150,000 Allied soldiers arrived in France by sea and air to drive out the forces of Nazi Germany.
title: Lone piper plays at the moment British troops came ashore on D-Day 80 years ago

description: Britain's King Charles III addressed international veterans, government and military leaders in a ceremony at the start of events to mark the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings. The king called on today's generations to emulate the standards of those who gave their lives.
title: Britain's King Charles III honors the fallen of D-Day in Normandy, France

description: Kate, the Princess of Wales, is feeling “better,” Prince William said Wednesday, as his wife continues her cancer treatment out of the public eye. William was speaking to a veteran at a D-Day anniversary event in the English city of Portsmouth.
title: Watch: Prince William replies to D-Day vet's question about Kate's health

description: NBC News' Jay Gray in Normandy, France, sets the scene for the ceremonies that will be held to commemorate the 80th anniversary of the D-Day landings.
title: D-Day 80th anniversary commemorations set to start in Normandy, France

description: Israel targeted a Gaza school on Thursday that it said contained a Hamas compound, killing fighters involved in the Oct. 7 attacks. Hamas-run Gaza government officials said the strike killed at least 27 people seeking shelter in the U.N.-run school.
title: Israel targets U.N. school in Nuseirat, Gaza, claiming it held Hamas fighters

description: A 26-year-old Ukrainian-Russian man was arrested over a possible bomb plot after a homemade device exploded in his France hotel room. NBC News' Josh Lederman has more on the investigation.
title: Ukrainian-Russian man arrested after explosion in France hotel room
